result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather A Westlund was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Waushara Co. Case No. 16CF64.

miscConds.notes: Paid in full - bond previously posted has been applied.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is entitled to Huber Privileges and Good Time Credit. The court has no objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence currently being served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Heather A Westlund

records.addlTxt: Defendant Heather A Westlund in court, in custody, appears via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of her right to counsel - not eligible for SPD services. Defendant wishes to proceed to sentencing without counsel. Court accepts voluntary waiver of counsel. Parties have received the revocation packet. No corrections or clarifications noted by the DE. DA Anderson notes one correction. The parties stipulate to 83 days CFTS. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Sentencing argument by DA Anderson. Statement by DE regarding sentencing. Court orders: Ct 2 - 6 mos WC Jail consecutive to any other sentence currently being served - Huber, GT, 83 days CFTS, the Court has no objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction. Ct 4 - 30 days WC Jail - consecutive to Count 2. Appeal rights given.
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum

15CF45 & 16CF64 Cases called @ 1:15 p.m. Defendant Heather A Westlund in court with attorney Melinda R Alfredson-Clausen.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The parties have reached a resolution. Defendant advised of permissible punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: 15CF45: Cts 2 & 4 - NC. 16CF64: Ct 2 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 15CF45: Cts 1 & 3 - DRI. 16CF64: Cts 1, 3 & 4 - DRI. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Alfredson-Clausen. Statement by DE. Court orders: 16CF64: S/W 3 years probation - Conditions: AODA and follow through, DE must maintain absolute sobriety, DE may not be present upon the premises of any bars, DE is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Costs to include the DNA surcharge w/ 60 DTP or PP. 15CF45: S/W 2 years probation - Concurrent w/ 16CF64 - same conditions. 14 days CFTS applicable to both cases. Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 15, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

BOND ORDERED AS TO BOTH WAUSHARA CO CASE NOS. 2015CF000045 AND 2016CF000064.    The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Defendant must post an additional $1000.00 for release from custody.  The previously posted $3000.00 is subject to further review by the Court as to forfeiture.
Preliminary hearing/STC on May 5, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

15CF-45 and 16CF-64 - Both Cases Called @ 1:50 PM: Return on Warrants - Defendant Heather A Westlund in court in custody, appearing via video with attorney Melinda R Alfredson-Clausen, appearing in person.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes that Def failed to appear for Pre-Lim Hrg last week and warrants were issued.  Per Atty Alfredson-Clausen:  Would still be requesting another Pre-Lim be scheduled as to 16CF-64.  Time limits for Pre-Lim were not previously discussed.  The Court finds good cause exists for rescheduling the Pre-Lim hearing.  Time limit is also extended with good cause to conduct Pre-Lim.  DA argues as to add'l cash bond of $1000 in light of previous non-appearances.  Atty Alfredson-Clausen argues that previous bond ordered not be forfeited and reinstated.  The Court notes the $3000 bond is in jeopardy and understands that Def did appear late on the day in question.  Court will require and add'l $1000 cash bond be posted - the previous bond posted of $3000 will be subject to further review.  Some add'l cash will be appropriate prior to release.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

16CF-64 and 15CF-45 - Both Cases Called @ 2:55 PM: Attorney Alex Johnson for Melinda R Alfredson-Clausen in court.  Scott Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Per Atty Johnson:  Had just gotten a hold of his client to check her whereabouts and stated his client was not aware she had to be here today - she may be in route for the hearing.   Due to Court's calendar for the duration of the afternoon and in light of nonappearance, Bench Warrant authorized with Extradition Within the Continental US.  Court authorizes the release of the State's witnesses.

1:06 pm case called. Defendant Heather A Westlund in court with attorney William Michael Lennon.  Defendant Heather A Westlund in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over motion to withdraw by Attorney Lennon-was not able to address at FPT due to non-appearance of defendant. Court questions defendant regarding motion to withdraw. Defendant requests court allow withdrawal of Attorney Lennon. Court admonishes the defendant regarding appointment of counsel and the ability of SPD to appoint subsequent counsel. Court authorizes Attorney Lennon's withdrawal and directs defendant to petition SPD for counsel to be represented. Court directs Attorney Lennon to submit motion and order for withdrawal. Paperwork has been processed and defendant qualifies for SPD appointment of counsel. Court directs this matter to be heard with 16CF64.
Defendant in WC Jail
Body Only with Statewide Extradition

Case Called @ 9:11 AM: Attorney William Michael Lennon in court. Defendant Heather A Westlund not in court.  Scott Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Lennon - prior to his leaving on vacation he did speak with Def over the telephone and instructed her that she needed to appear today and it is believed that there is no resolution and the JT would proceed.  He did receive a telephone message from Def on 3/31 that she was instructing him to withdraw.  Court authorizes issuance of a warrant for the Defendant with extradition within the Continental US.  Orders Default as to 15TR-1107 with the bond amount Noted on the citation - 60 DTP.  Court will clear the JT scheduled for 4/14/2016 - imprudent for counsel to prepare for JT with Def's status unknown.  Court will await the execution of the warrant.  Court will hold in abeyance the informal motion for counsel to withdraw.  Atty Lennon will not proceed with a written motion to withdraw until he speaks with his client and the unknown reasoning.  Per DA:  His analyst will be notified that the JT has been cancelled.  Court will not withdraw the warrant for any reason and will await execution of same.   Cash Bond ordered forfeited - $500.00.

Court goes over motion to withdraw filed by Attorney Lennon. Court questions defendant. Statement by defendant regarding appointment of counsel. Statement by Court to defendant regarding appointment of counsel. Statement by Attorney Lennon-is willing to continue to represent the defendant in this matter until consolidation in Wood County. Court orders defendant to be up to date with court appointed attorney payments by November 15, 2015. Statement by Attorney Blader regarding consolidation to Wood County.
